snippet: A major goal of the Affordable Care Act was to improve the financial security of previously uninsured people. A new survey suggests this is happening.
abstract: The Upshot; Commonwealth Fund survey finds number of Americans having financial problems over their medical bills has started to drop, giving new evidence that Affordable Care Act is helping improve financial security for individuals and families, a major goal of the law.
lead_paragraph: A major goal of the Affordable Care Act was to improve the financial security of previously uninsured people. A new survey suggests this is happening.

headline.print_headline: Distress Appears to Ease Over Cost of Health Care
headline.main: Signs of a Decline in Financial Distress Connected to Medical Bills

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
